    Numbers Class

    class QDocTests::Numbers

    The Numbers class provides functions for manipulating numbers. More...

    Header: #include <Numbers>

    Detailed Description

    Member Function Documentation

    template <typename T> T Numbers::add(T a, T b)

    Adds two numbers of the same underlying type.

    Returns a value containing the sum of a and b.

    auto Numbers::add(int a, int b)

    Adds two numbers.

    Returns an integer containing the sum of a and b.

    template <typename ThisIsMyReallyLongAndComplicatedTemplateName> auto Numbers::adder(ThisIsMyReallyLongAndComplicatedTemplateName a, int b)

    Adds two numbers of the same underlying type.

    Returns a value containing the sum of a and b.

    auto Numbers::number() const

    Returns the number.

    Returns the number, whatever it may be.

    See also setNumber().

    void Numbers::setNumber(int number)

    Sets the number.

    Sets the number to number, and expects nothing more.

    See also number().

    auto Numbers::subtract(int a, int b)

    Subtracts two numbers.

    Returns an integer containing the difference of a and b.
